headline: Is Realty Income a Millionaire-Maker Stock?
summary: Let's explore the pros and cons of Realty Income (NYSE: O) to decide if it has a place in your long-term investment portfolio.  Real estate is one of the greatest wealth creators in the world.  Real estate investment trusts (REITs) were created to give regular investors access to this industry while minimizing its traditional downsides, like illiquidity.

raw.headline: Is Realty Income a Millionaire-Maker Stock?

headline: This Brilliant Move Could Enable Realty Income to Make Its Investors Richer in the Future
summary: Realty Income (NYSE: O) has done a fantastic job of growing shareholder value over the years.  The real estate investment trust (REIT) has produced a 14.1% compound annual total return since its public market listing in 1994.  The REIT has grown by investing shareholder capital into income-generating net lease real estate.

headline: Could Buying High-Yield Realty Income Today Set You Up for Life?
summary: Realty Income (NYSE: O) is not going to excite you, but if history is any guide, it will keep paying you well year in and year out.  What does Realty Income do?  Realty Income is a net lease REIT, which means that its tenants pay most property-level operating costs.
